channel.title: Major Digest - Reliable and Comprehensive News Sources: world
channel.description: Get the latest news online at Major Digest, the top online news resource for the most reliable news sources. Stay informed about the world around you!

image.title: Major Digest - Reliable and Comprehensive News Sources: world

item.title: North Korea allowing citizens abroad to return home for first time since 2020, state media says
item.description: North Korea is allowing its citizens who have been forced to stay abroad because of the COVID-19 pandemic to return home, according to state media.
item.dc:creator: Fox News

item.title: Russia says it confirmed Wagner leader Prigozhin died in a plane crash
item.description: MOSCOW (AP) — Russian authorities on Sunday confirmed the death of Wagner Group chief Yevgeny Prigozhin, putting to rest any doubts about whether the wily mercenary leader turned mutineer was on a plane that crashed Wednesday, killing everyone on board.
item.dc:creator: AP, KGET 17, NBC

item.title: More than 600 firefighters backed by water-dropping aircraft struggle to control wildfires in Greece
item.description: ATHENS, Greece (AP) — More than 600 firefighters, including reinforcements from several European countries and backed by a fleet of water-dropping planes and helicopters, were tackling the remnants of three major wildfires in Greece Sunday, two of which have been raging for days.
item.dc:creator: ELENA BECATOROS, Associated Press, KGET 17, NBC

item.title: Ukraine investigates incident that killed 3 pilots while Russia attacks with cruise missiles
item.description: KYIV, Ukraine (AP) — Ukrainian authorities have launched an investigation after a midair collision between two warplanes in the west of the country killed three pilots.
item.dc:creator: SUSIE BLANN, Associated Press, KGET 17, NBC

item.title: At Japanese nuclear plant, controversial treated water release just the beginning of decommissioning
item.description: OKUMA, Japan (AP) — At a small section of the Fukushima Daiichi nuclear plant’s central control room in northeastern Japan, the treated water transfer switch is on.
item.dc:creator: MARI YAMAGUCHI, Associated Press, KGET 17, NBC

item.title: At Japanese nuclear plant, controversial treated water release just the beginning of decommissioning
item.description: The sound of treated radioactive water flowing down to an underground secondary pool could be heard from beneath the ground during a media tour of Japan's Fukushima Daiichi nuclear power plant.
item.dc:creator: Mari Yamaguchi, Associated Press, KPRC 2

item.title: A US Marine Osprey crashes during drills in Australia, killing 3 and injuring 20, some critically
item.description: CANBERRA, Australia (AP) — A United States Marine Corps aircraft with 23 Marines aboard crashed on a north Australian island Sunday, killing at least three and critically injuring at least five during a multinational training exercise, officials said.
item.dc:creator: ROD McGUIRK, Associated Press, KGET 17, NBC

item.title: DNA test confirms Yevgeny Prigozhin was aboard crashed jet, Russia says
item.description: DNA testing confirmed that Wagner mercenary chief Yevgeny Prigozhin was among those aboard the jet that crashed outside Moscow on Wednesday, Russia says.
item.dc:creator: Fox News

item.title: Wagner boss confirmed dead by Russian officials
item.description: A Russian investigation concluded on Sunday that Yevgeniy Prigozhin, the longtime leader of the Wagner Group, was killed in the aircraft crash last week that killed all those on board.
item.dc:creator: Sarah Fortinsky, The Hill

item.title: Prigozhin's final months were overshadowed by questions about what the Kremlin had in store for him
item.description: TALLINN, Estonia (AP) — Yevgeny Prigozhin smiled as a crowd of adoring fans surrounded his black SUV on June 24 in Russia’s southern city of Rostov-on-Don and cheered him on.
item.dc:creator: DASHA LITVINOVA, Associated Press, KREX 5

item.title: Zimbabwe's opposition alleges 'gigantic fraud' in vote that extends the ZANU-PF party's 43-year rule
item.description: Zimbabwe’s main opposition leader has alleged “blatant and gigantic fraud” after President Emmerson Mnangagwa was declared the winner of another troubled election in the southern African nation.
item.dc:creator: Farai Mutsaka And Gerald Imray, Associated Press, KPRC 2

item.title: Russia says it confirmed Wagner leader Prigozhin died in a plane crash
item.description: Russia’s Investigative Committee has confirmed Wagner chief Yevgeny Prigozhin was killed in a plane crash.
item.dc:creator: Associated Press, KPRC 2

item.title: Ukraine investigates incident that killed 3 pilots while Russia attacks with cruise missiles
item.description: Ukrainian authorities have launched an investigation after a midair collision between two warplanes in the west of the country killed three pilots.
item.dc:creator: Associated Press, KPRC 2

item.title: More than 600 firefighters backed by water-dropping aircraft struggle to control wildfires in Greece
item.description: More than 600 firefighters, including reinforcements from several European countries and backed by a fleet of water-dropping planes and helicopters, are tackling the remnants of three major wildfires in Greece, two of which have been raging for days.
item.dc:creator: Elena Becatoros, Associated Press, KPRC 2

item.title: Zimbabwean President Emmerson Mnangagwa wins re-election after troubled vote, officials say
item.description: HARARE, Zimbabwe (AP) — Zimbabwean President Emmerson Mnangagwa was re-elected for a second and final five-year term late Saturday in results announced much earlier than expected following another troubled vote in the southern African country with a history of violent and disputed elections.
item.dc:creator: FARAI MUTSAKA and GERALD IMRAY, Associated Press, KREX 5

item.title: US military aircraft carrying more than 20 Marines crashes over Australia, killing 3 and injuring others
item.description: A military aircraft with more than 20 U.S. Marines onboard crashed Sunday near Melville Island in Australia's Northern Territory. No Australians were involved in the crash.
item.dc:creator: Fox News

item.title: UK's $125M AI chip investment not enough to keep pace in tech race, experts warn: 'Go big or go home'
item.description: The U.K.'s Research and Innovation group plans to buy 5,000 graphical processing units (GPUs) from Nvidia, but experts say that far more is needed to compete in the sector.
item.dc:creator: Fox News

item.title: Russia's top mercenary force faces uncertain future, threat to survival following warlord's apparent demise
item.description: Yevgeny Prigozhin was reportedly one of 10 people aboard his private plane when an explosion caused it to crash, though reports of a missile attack remain unconfirmed.
item.dc:creator: Fox News

item.title: Women working in Antarctica say they were left to fend for themselves against sexual harassers
item.description: Many women who work at McMurdo Station, the main United States research base in Antarctica, say the isolated environment and macho culture have allowed sexual harassment and assault to flourish.
item.dc:creator: Nick Perry, Associated Press, Local 4

item.title: With drones and webcams, volunteer hunters join new search for mythical Loch Ness Monster
item.description: Mystery hunters converged on a Scottish lake on Saturday to look for signs of the mythical Loch Ness Monster.
item.dc:creator: Jill Lawless, WFLA, NBC

item.title: A gang in Haiti opens fire on a crowd of parishioners trying to rid the community of criminals
item.description: PORT-AU-PRINCE, Haiti (AP) — A powerful gang opened fire Saturday on a large group of parishioners led by a pastor as they marched through a community armed with machetes to rid the area of gang members.
item.dc:creator: EVENS SANON, Associated Press, KREX 5

item.title: Elite unit of Mexican cartel using drones to drop bombs: Report
item.description: The Jalisco New Generation cartel has created a specialized drone unit where members are trained to turn commercial drones into flying bombs.
item.dc:creator: Jorge Ventura, NewsNation

item.title: Biden honors service members killed during Afghanistan withdrawal
item.description: President Joe Biden honored 13 service members who died during an attack while the U.S. was withdrawing from Afghanistan two years ago in a statement Saturday. A bomb by the Abbey Gate at Hamid Karzai International Airport in Kabul on Aug. 26, 2021, killed 13 U.S.
item.dc:creator: Tara Suter, The Hill

item.title: Zimbabwean President Emmerson Mnangagwa wins re-election after troubled vote, officials say
item.description: Authorities in Zimbabwe say President Emmerson Mnangagwa has been re-elected for a second and final term.
item.dc:creator: Farai Mutsaka, Associated Press, Local 4

item.title: UN experts say Islamic State group almost doubled the territory they control in Mali in under a year
item.description: UNITED NATIONS (AP) — Islamic State extremists have almost doubled the territory they control in Mali in less than a year, and their al-Qaida-linked rivals are capitalizing on the deadlock and perceived weakness of armed groups that signed a 2015 peace agreement, United Nations experts said in a new
item.dc:creator: EDITH M. LEDERER, Associated Press, KREX 5

item.title: Mexico '99.9% certain' to elect first female president, expert says
item.description: Mexico in less than 10 months will elect a new president, and polls increasingly point to the new "strong man" being a woman.
item.dc:creator: Julian Resendiz, NewsNation

item.title: SpaceX, NASA launch international crew to space station: 'A united team with a common mission'
item.description: Four astronauts from four different countries launched from NASA’s Kennedy Space Center in Florida to the International Space Station in a SpaceX spacecraft Saturday.
item.dc:creator: Tara Suter, The Hill

item.title: McCarthy orders Capitol flag at half-staff to honor 13 service members killed in Afghanistan exit
item.description: House Speaker Kevin McCarthy (R-Calif.) announced Saturday that he ordered the flags at the U.S. Capitol to be put at half-staff in honor of 13 American service members who died in Afghanistan while attempting to help allies flee the country during the U.S. exit two years ago.
item.dc:creator: Tara Suter, The Hill

item.title: Reporter Evan Gershkovich appeals extension of detention in Russia
item.description: Wall Street Journal reporter Evan Gershkovich has appealed a Moscow court’s decision to extend his pretrial detention in Russia until the end of November, according to documents on the court’s website.
item.dc:creator: AP, NewsNation

item.title: Crush of people at opening ceremony of the Indian Ocean Island Games in Madagascar kills at least 12
item.description: ANTANANARIVO, Madagascar (AP) — A crush of people at a stadium in Madagascar left at least 12 dead and 85 injured as sports fans attended the opening ceremony of the Indian Ocean Island Games, authorities said Saturday.
item.dc:creator: LAETITIA BEZAIN, Associated Press, NewsNation

item.title: India's lunar rover keeps walking on the moon, days after spacecraft's historic touchdown
item.description: NEW DELHI (AP) — India's lunar rover continued its walk on the moon Friday after the historic touch-down of India's spacecraft near the moon's south pole earlier this week, the country's space agency said.
item.dc:creator: ASHOK SHARMA, Associated Press, WGN 9

item.title: Dutch brewer Heineken sells its Russian operations for 1 euro, taking a 300-million-euro hit
item.description: THE HAGUE, Netherlands (AP) — Dutch brewer Heineken has completed its withdrawal from Russia, 18 months after Moscow launched its full-scale invasion of Ukraine, selling its business in Russia for just 1 euro, the company announced Friday.
item.dc:creator: AP, WGN 9

item.title: FIFA opens case against Spanish soccer official who kissed player on lips at Women's World Cup
item.description: FIFA opened a disciplinary case Thursday against the Spanish soccer official who kissed a player on the lips while celebrating the team's victory in the Women’s World Cup final.
item.dc:creator: Graham Dunbar, WFLA, NBC

item.title: Putin breaks silence on plane crash that presumably killed Wagner leaders
item.description: Russian President Vladimir Putin has broken his silence on the plane crash that killed top leaders of the Wagner mercenary group.
item.dc:creator: The Associated Press, WFLA, NBC

item.title: India lands a spacecraft near the moon's south pole, a first for the world as it joins elite club
item.description: India became the first country to land a spacecraft near the moon’s south pole on Wednesday — a historic voyage to uncharted territory that scientists believe could hold vital reserves of frozen water, and a technological triumph for the world’s most populous nation.
item.dc:creator: ASHOK SHARMA, WFLA, NBC

item.title: India successfully lands its Chandrayaan-3 rover on the moon, near the south pole
item.description: NEW DELHI (AP) — India was counting down to landing a spacecraft near the moon’s south pole Wednesday — an unchartered territory that scientists believe could hold important reserves of frozen water and precious elements.
item.dc:creator: ASHOK SHARMA, Associated Press, WGN 9

item.title: Search continues for Cuban coach who disappeared from Little League World Series
item.description: Investigators say the search continues for Cuba's Little League World Series coach Monday, despite reports that he's been found.
item.dc:creator: Vivian Muniz, WGN 9
